skill.name: resource-monitor
skill.description: Monitor system resources (CPU, memory, disk, network) during development and production.
skill.summary: Monitor system resources (CPU, memory, disk, network) during development and production.
skill.author: CuriousLearner

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only documentation and example code blocks. No executable files, no network calls, no file system access, and no command execution capabilities. The skill provides guidance for an AI assistant to help users understand system resource monitoring.

content.user_title: Monitor system resources like CPU and memory
content.value_statement: System resource issues cause slowdowns and outages. This skill provides expert guidance for monitoring CPU, memory, disk, and network usage to identify bottlenecks and optimize performance.
actual_capabilities: Monitor CPU usage and load averages
Analyze memory consumption and detect leaks
Check disk space and I/O performance
limitations: Does not execute monitoring commands automatically
Requires user to run commands in their terminal
Does not persist monitoring data or history
Cannot access system metrics without user action

use_cases.title: Production monitoring
use_cases.description: Track resource usage in production environments and identify bottlenecks before they cause outages.

use_cases.title: Debug performance issues
use_cases.description: Diagnose why an application is running slowly by analyzing CPU, memory, and disk patterns.

use_cases.title: Capacity planning
use_cases.description: Monitor trends over time to plan infrastructure upgrades and prevent resource exhaustion.

prompt_templates.title: Quick status check
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me the current CPU, memory, and disk usage on this system.

prompt_templates.title: Find resource hogs
prompt_templates.prompt: Which processes are using the most CPU and memory right now?

prompt_templates.title: Monitor specific process
prompt_templates.prompt: Monitor the resource usage of the node process with PID 1234.

prompt_templates.title: Set up alerts
prompt_templates.prompt: What are recommended alert thresholds for CPU, memory, and disk usage?

best_practices: Monitor resources regularly, not just when issues occur
Set up alerts for thresholds before critical levels are reached
Keep historical data to identify trends and plan capacity
anti_patterns: Ignoring warning signs until they become critical outages
Setting alert thresholds too low, causing alert fatigue
Monitoring without acting on the data collected

faq.question: Does this skill run monitoring commands?
faq.answer: No. This skill provides guidance. You must run the actual commands in your terminal.

faq.question: Can it monitor remote servers?
faq.answer: Yes. Use SSH to connect to remote servers, then run monitoring commands there.

faq.question: What monitoring tools does it support?
faq.answer: It covers standard tools like top, free, df, netstat, and integrations with Prometheus, Grafana, and CloudWatch.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill only provides instructions. All monitoring happens locally on your system.

faq.question: Why are resources showing as high?
faq.answer: Common causes include memory leaks, inefficient code, too many processes, or insufficient resources for your workload.

faq.question: How is this different from htop or top?
faq.answer: This skill is an AI assistant that explains what metrics mean and how to interpret them. htop and top are the actual command-line tools.
